newsitem.title: FRANCE: Promodes plans no change in ties with GIB.
newsitem.headline: Promodes plans no change in ties with GIB.

text.p: French retailer Promodes, which has a 20 percent stake in a subsidiary of Belgian retailing group GIB, has no plans to modify the terms of the alliance between the two groups, a spokesman for Promodes said on Monday.

"We have no plans to modify the alliance with GIB," the spokesman told Reuters. Promodes last year took a 20 percent stake in GIB subsidiary BIGG as part of a commercial accord to bring down purchasing costs and cooperate in logistics and communications operations.
The chairman of Cobepa said in an interview the group was studying options for its 17.6 percent stake in GIB.

Chairman Pierre Scohier told La Libre Belgique newspaper at the weekend that among the options was the entry of Promodes into the capital of GIB supermarket unit GB, or the spinoff of some GIB stores.
